definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)

sentences.english: Lantern Festival day everywhere decorated, beaming.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节这天到处张灯结彩，喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: The streets were illuminated for the celebration.
sentences.chinese: 街上张灯结彩以进行庆祝。

sentences.english: Our long-awaited opening of English and thoughtful, and the campus decorated.
sentences.chinese: 我们盼望已久的英语开放周到了，校园里张灯结彩。

sentences.english: The staff trooped through the gaily decorated court.
sentences.chinese: 全体工作人同结队走过张灯结彩的院子。

sentences.english: The New Year decorations are seen in the street and an atmosphere of happiness prevails everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 大街上张灯结彩，处处洋溢着欢乐的气氛。

sentences.english: Sitting in a resplendent hall bedecked with silk.
sentences.chinese: 坐在辉煌的结彩的堂上。

sentences.english: Across the United States, people use lights and decorations to mark the Christmas holidays.
sentences.chinese: 全美各地的人们都在张灯结彩庆祝圣诞节。

sentences.english: The downtowns of all cities were lighted for Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 所有城市的闹市区都为圣诞张灯结彩。

definition: to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
to drape sb in red silk as a sign of honor
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
usher out the old, greet the new/esp. to see in the New Year
long-lived people, rich harvests (idiom); stable and affluent society/prosperity
